intro: Diplostephium cinerascens subsp. puracense, commonly known as the Puracén Whitebark, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Central America, particularly found in countries like Guatemala and Honduras. This shrub typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine, white pubescence. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits that contain several seeds.
